font.b: In an effort for Reese Public Schools to educate our students during the COVID-19 pandemic, RPS will be making chrome books available to student for home use in grade 6-11. While students will be able to use there own preferred device, a number of chrome books will be avalable to students that do not have their own device. If you are in need of a Chromebook, please contact Mr. Galsterer (bgalsterer@reese.k12.mi.us) or fill out the attached form at the following link

div.b: Please click on this link to read the April 15, 2020 letter to Reese Families regarding Continuity of Learning during Coronavirus (COVID-19).

div.font: Click here for Elementary Staff office hours.

font.a: Click here for Middle/High Staff office hours.
Please click on this link to access the full Continuity of Learning Plan for Reese Public Schools.

b.font: Working with Reese Public Schools and volunteers, we will continue to feed our students during the COVID-19 statewide school building closure. We will provide
meals to any students ages 18 and younger or up to 26 with a disability.

In an effort to continue to meet the needs of our students as well as keep all of our families safe by limiting exposure, Reese Public Schools is adjusting our food distribution system. Beginning Tuesday, April 7th until further notice, we will distribute meals for the entire week on Tuesdays from 10:00 am - noon via drive up service at Reese Elementary and Reese Middle/High, as well as delivery for those who have arranged. This will be the only day and time available for food distribution each week. Using this method, families will have their entire allotment of food for the entire week while only having to make one stop.
We understand that parents will have to work and some students may not have a parent to bring them or pick up their food. Students may walk up or bike to pick up their meals each Tuesday.

We also have a group of staff and community members who are volunteering their time and will be dropping off breakfast, lunch, and groceries to families who can’t get to the schools to pick up on the dates above. If you are in need of this service, please email me at kwetters@reese.k12.mi.us and add “food service” to the subject line.

Please take advantage of this opportunity to help us feed the children in our district. If you have any questions regarding the program, please contact me Keith Wetters, Reese Public School, superintendent at kwetters@reese.k12.mi.us.

div.b: Reese Schools provides FREE BREAKFAST TO EVERY STUDENT!

div.div: Congratulations to the RHS Class of 2020!
All district Annual Education Reports (AER) can be found under the district info drop down box. Each AER provides key information

on the educational progress for Reese Public Schools. The AER addresses the complex reporting information required by federal and some requirements of state laws. Please contact Keith Wetters, Superintendent, if you need assistance interpreting the information.

div.span: Reese is now taking applications for preschool Great Start Readiness Program (GSRP)! This is a central intake link with our Tuscola Intermediate School District. Families interested in preschool can follow the link to apply. Your application will be submitted to an enrollment team which will review your application and the documentation you submit. There are many free and low-cost options, please apply regardless of income. If you need assistance in completing the application, please call the number included in the link.

Reese Public Schools is committed to a continual process of improvement throughout each building and across the district. School Improvement plans are reviewed, updated and submitted to the Michigan Department of Education annually. All school improvement plans can be found under the district info drop down box.

a.data-caption: Thank you for the opportunity to share two days with this amazing group of educators. Sarah Matinkhah, Katie Bauer, Kris Krieger, and Brooke Satkowiak absolutely rocked it at Capturing Kids’ Hearts at SVSU. This powerful program reinforces the importance of building relationships with our students. Our staff shared their passion for their profession and for the students of Reese Public Schools with educators from across the country. Proud to be a Rocket! —Keith

div.div: You can download an App for iPad, iPhone, or Android by clicking the link above on your mobile device (or go under your App Store and search for Skyward!).
If you have at least 90 hours from a 4 year university with a GPA of 2.0 or higher, you are eligible to Substitute Teach. Reese Public Schools hires all of their Substitute Teachers though PCMI.
Students First: Compassion, Commitment, and Community!
•Each Student has strengths and the ability to achieve
•In a compassionate atmosphere that connects each student
•In fostering a responsible, respectful, and safe community.
We will provide an educational journey that inspires each individual to achieve their full potential in a safe and caring environment.
*Click here to see the complete Strategic Plan Summary
